snippet.textDisplay: I've been in the From Soulborne mood recently, replaying a bit of Demon's, Dark Souls 1, and Elden Ring. I should install this again. snippet.textDisplay: Everyone who is saying you have to buy it again is wrong. It is NOT a different game with new characters and new places; it is the same game, but with one added (new) npc whom was originally in the dark souls series before. Also they are NOT adding new enemies it is the same enemies just placed differently. Basically they revamped the game, and added a new character who will change how the story is experienced, by giving the player a "new path" to choose. And finally you won't have to pay for any of this! (Unless you have not yet purchased the dlc's) The amped up version of the game will be made available to everyone on all platforms through an upgrade- upgrade 1.10 to be exact- on April 7th 2015; the only exceptions are PC users. They will have to pay for the new update. That makes no sense to me, but it's what I have researched; hopefully this ends ALL speculation.
snippet.textOriginal: Everyone who is saying you have to buy it again is wrong. It is NOT a different game with new characters and new places; it is the same game, but with one added (new) npc whom was originally in the dark souls series before. Also they are NOT adding new enemies it is the same enemies just placed differently. Basically they revamped the game, and added a new character who will change how the story is experienced, by giving the player a "new path" to choose. And finally you won't have to pay for any of this! (Unless you have not yet purchased the dlc's) The amped up version of the game will be made available to everyone on all platforms through an upgrade- upgrade 1.10 to be exact- on April 7th 2015; the only exceptions are PC users. They will have to pay for the new update. That makes no sense to me, but it's what I have researched; hopefully this ends ALL speculation.

snippet.textDisplay: I'll buy it for sure even though I have finished it several times on ps3 with all the dlc's, it is still a better game than most that are comming. To me it has been quite a rewarding experience and I haven't felt this way about a game since Ocarina of time. It's just a game that I love. I respect people who doesn't like it or criticize it because of its graphics or because of the fact that they are making double money with the same proyect, I get what they mean. But still I'm excited by playing it all the way over with next gen graphics and the possibility of more dlc's.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly, I'm getting sick and tired of game developers thinking that it's okay to release the same exact game on next gen consoles when they could have just released it all together with last gen versions. Watch the same thing happen with Borderlands: The pre-sequel.
